spell.name: Precognition

m.text: a gemstone worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i Focusing your magic you seek the best path ahead, allowing you to react to the immediate future.}
Until the end of your next turn you may reroll any failed attack rolls, ability checks and saving throws for the duration, accepting the second roll even if it is also a failure.
Additionally, other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you for the duration.

spell.name: Robert's Coin
entries: You coerce the strands of fate to be either incredibly cruel or incredibly kind to you. The next time you are required to roll a {@dice d20} during the spell's duration, flip a coin and choose a side instead. If the side you chose lands face up, your {@dice d20} roll is a natural 20; otherwise it is a natural 1.
Once you have substituted a roll, the spell ends.

spell.name: Foxfire's Curse

components.m: a weighted dice or any unlucky object

entries: An air of misfortune surrounds your target; making anything that could go badly, go badly without great effort. One creature of your choice within range must succeed a Charisma saving throw whenever they make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw (other than saving throws against this spell). On a failed saving throw, the creature treats a {@dice d20} roll of 11 or higher as a 10.

spell.name: Roar's Malediction
entries: You toy with potential futures to make your foe's attacks barely scratch their targets. One creature of your choice within range must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save each time the target rolls damage for an attack or spell, they must roll each damage die twice and choose the lower result.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Ambling Abode
entries: Choose a building no larger than 30 feet wide or long and no taller than two stories; then flip a coin. On a heads the building sprouts a pair of bird legs, it becomes awakened and acts with a mind of its own for the duration of the spell. The building acts similar to a domesticated chicken unless controlled by other means. At sundown the building will find a smaller one to nest upon.
On a tails the building grows wings and flies away. At the next sundown the building will find a high place to nest upon.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the maximum size for building increases by 10 feet for the width and length, and an additional story for the height.

spell.name: Borrowed Time
entries: You reach forward in time to steal life essence from the future to heal the present. Choose a willing creature that you can see within range, which may include yourself; that creature regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. At the end of the duration the creature takes necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, equal to the amount that was healed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Rewind

components.m: a pocketwatch, hourglass, or similar timepiece

entries: You intertwine yourself in a moment with a space in time, briefly continuining before snapping back to your past self. When you cast this spell note down the location where you cast it and your current hit points. At the end of your next turn you revert back to the noted location and your hitpoints change to match the noted amount.

If the location is occupied when you return to it, you and whatever occupies it take {@damage 5d10} force damage. You then appear in the nearest unoccupied space. If the force damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you and everything you are wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration for the spell increases by one additional turn. For example, casting this spell with a spell slot of 5th level means you revert to the noted location at the end of your third turn after casting the spell.

spell.name: Prescience
entries: {@i You effortlessly predict the paths of shots and swords. By focussing your magic even more closely you can even guide your allies' aim.}
Choose a creature you can see within range, which may include yourself. That creature has advantage on attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Foreboding
entries: {@i Using your magical insights, you are able to predict when your foes are about to charge or throw an attack, even before they themselves have realised it.}

Choose two creatures you can see within range, which may include yourself. Until the spell ends the targets can use their reaction to make a single melee attack against a creature that makes an attack against them within their reach.
The creature may instead use their reaction to make a single ranged attack against a creature that moves at least 5 feet towards them within their spell's or weapon's range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Misfortune

components.m: a weighted dice or any unlucky object

entries: {@i You twist the strands of fate to allow the strongest of blows to be dealt to your enemies.}

Choose up to three creatures you can see within range, they must succeed a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, until the spell ends any damage die rolled against the target may be re-rolled, choosing the higher of the two results. This only affects the damage dealt to the target of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Summon Mageblade
entries: You evoke an ethereal blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a longsword, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.

The blade is treated as a melee weapon that you are proficient with and that deals {@damage 2d4} force damage on a hit. You can choose to add your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of your Strength modifier.
Additionally the blade sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

spell.name: Jaden's Duel Detection
entries: For the duration, you sense the presence of conflicts, duels or other altercations within 120 feet of you. If you sense conflict in this way, you can use your action to determine, if any, the name and rules of the current conflict as well as the number of combatants or players.
Such a spell will also detect the presence of any active card games.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: Endurance
entries: {@i You reach into the essence of a creature, willing them to reknit bones, heal flesh and banish fatigue so they can continue the fight.}
Choose one creature you can see within range, which may include yourself. For the duration of the spell the chosen creature gains the following benefits:
The first time the creature is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it drops to 1 hit point instead.
If the creature takes damage that is greater than half its hit point maximum, the creature instead takes half its hit point maximum in damage.
The creature has resistance to all non-magical damage.
The creature's movement speed can never be reduced below 10 feet.

spell.name: Forewarning
entries: {@i Your prophetic powers allow you to walk through a hail of arrows unscathed and dodge weapon blows the split second they're made.}
Choose a creature you can see within range, which may include yourself. Until the spell ends it gains a +2 bonus to AC and it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, you may target two creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, you may target three creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you may target four creatures instead of one.

spell.name: Haemorrhage
entries: {@i Reaching forth with your magic you set a fire within a victim's flesh. Within moments, the unfortunate foe's blood begins to boil in their veins, tearing them asunder as it bursts from every pore.}

Choose one creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell it dies instantly and you may select another target within 15 feet of the last, and within 30 feet of you, to make a Constitution saving throw as if they were the original target of the spell.

spell.name: Iron Arm
entries: {@i You weave your magic to turn your flesh into living metal, allowing you to shrug off hits and pulp skulls with your bare fists.}

For the duration of the spell you gain a +3 bonus to your Strength and Consitution scores. This may raise your scores above 20 but not above 30. The increase to your Constitution also increases your maximum hit points, the amount it increases by is also added to your current hit points; both increases last until the spell ends.
Additionally you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and you can roll a {@dice d4} in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strikes.

spell.name: Perfect Timing
entries: {@i Briefly scanning the immediate future you use your magic to seek out the best moments to strike at your enemies.}
Choose a creature you can see within range, which may include yourself. Until the spell ends the creature's attacks ignore the effects of half and three-quarters cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Smite
entries: Four lethal bolts of lightning leap from your fingertips, tearing your foes apart. You can hurl them at one target or several.
Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8 + 1} lightning damage. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armour made of metal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional bolt for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Absorb Impact

time.condition: which you take when you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage

entries: The spell captures some of the incoming energy, lessening its effect on you and storing it for your next melee attack. You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Also, the first time you hit with a melee attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the triggering type, and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Life Leech
entries: You create a pair of dark tendrils that lash out from you at targets within range.

Make a ranged spell attack for each tendril. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage and you, or one creature you choose within range, regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional tendril for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Enfeeble
entries: You channel your magic into tendrils of energy that lash over a victim, each caress sapping strength and vitality from their body. Choose one target within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save, until the spell ends the target's Strength and Constitution scores are reduced by 3 and their movement speed is halved. The target dies if this reduces its Strength or Constitution to 0. The decrease to the target's Constitution also decreases its maximum hitpoints, the amount it decreases by is also removed from its current hit points; both decreases last until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the Strength and Constitution score reduction increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Arcane Speed
entries: {@i Magical power flows through you, heightening your speed to supernatural levels.}
Until the spell ends your speed is doubled, you gain a +5 bonus to Initiative rolls, and you may use your bonus action to make an attack whenever you take the Attack action.

spell.name: Flame Breath
entries: A torrent of magical fire pours forth from your eyes and mouth, engulfing targets in its path. You exhale fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

On a failed save, the target also burns. The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Dexterity saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fiery Form

m.text: a ruby worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You transform yourself, along with everything you're wearing and carrying, into a being of living fire for the duration. The spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or become completely submerged in water.

While in this form, your only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. You shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. You can enter and occupy the space of another creature; the first time on a turn you do the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

You have resistance to nonmagical damage, immunity to fire damage, and have advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. You can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though you treat liquids as though they are solid surfaces. You can't fall and remain hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

While in the form of living fire you can't talk, you can reroll a 1 or a 2 on the damage die of any fire damage you deal and when your attacks hit, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw or start burning. The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Dexterity saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

spell.name: Spontaneous Combustion
entries: {@i You focus your anger into a creature, boiling and burning it from the inside out with arcane fire that threatens to burst forth.}
Choose one creature within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If damage from this spell reduces the initial target to 0 hit points, it dies and its body explodes in fire. Each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures gain no benefit from cover, except full cover, against this spell. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage and starts burning on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Dexterity saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

spell.name: Flame Burst
entries: {@i An incandescent aura builds around you, growing brighter and hotter until it explodes in a flash with the fury of a supernova.}

Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures gain no benefit from cover, except full cover, against this spell. A creature takes {@damage 6d8} fire damage and starts burning on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Dexterity saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Inferno
entries: {@i Setting the very air alight, you create a whirling pillar of fire.}

Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures gain no benefit from cover, except full cover, against this spell. A target takes {@damage 4d10} fire damage and starts burning on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Dexterity saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Soulblaze
entries: {@i You use your magic to set the very soul of a being alight.}

Choose a creature you can see within range, it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also starts burning.

The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Constitution saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Molten beam
entries: {@i You clap your hands together and turn them towards your foes, as you do so a white-hot beam of blazing magical energy bursts forth from your palms; melting armour and vaporising flesh, this beam leaves only ghastly shadows in its wake.}

The beam is 30 feet long, 5 feet wide and blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.
If damage from this spell kills a target, the target and all of its nonmagical belongings are turned to ash.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Assail
entries: {@i Using nothing but the power of your magic, you tear a boulder of rock from the ground and hurl it towards your enemies.}

The boulder flies in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and has its movement speed halved until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Crush
entries: {@i By reaching out your arm and clenching your fist, you entrap a foe in a choking and crushing mass of force. Gritting their teeth, you continue the assault until flesh, armour and bone alike are ground to powder.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Strength saving throw. The target takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained} on a failed save or half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained} on a successful one.

At the end of each of the target's turns before the spell ends, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Objuration Mechanicum
entries: {@i Bows break and swords snag as you use your powers to wrench and twist at the weapons of your enemies.}

Choose a number of targets equal to your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1) you can see within range. They must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the target makes an attack roll with a weapon and the {@dice d20} roll is a 1 or 2, the attack misses regardless of any modifiers or the target of the attack's AC and the target of this spell takes the attack's damage themselves as if they were the target of the attack.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number the target needs to roll to trigger the spell's effect increases by 1; for example, using a slot of 3rd level would trigger the attack to miss and redirect the damage on a roll of 1, 2, 3 or 4.

spell.name: Shockwave
entries: {@i You slam your palms together and the noise is magnified a hundredfold, releasing a shockwave that snaps bones and knocks foes from their feet.}

Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d12} thunder damage, is knocked {@condition prone} and has its movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn on a failed save or takes half as much damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone} and doesn't have its movement speed reduced on a successful one. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area, and the spell emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Telekine Dome

m.text: powder made by crushing a clear gemstone worth 50gp, which is consumed by the spell

entries: {@i Arrows bounce off thin air and are deflected harmlessly away as you erect a barrier of shimmering energy about yourself.}
Each creature within range gains a +3 bonus to their AC, as well as their Strength and Dexterity saving throws against attacks, spells and effects from outside the radius of the spell.

spell.name: Magic Maelstrom
entries: {@i You focus your entire magical might into creating a vast maelstrom of destructive power, unleashing a storm of arcane energy that utterly consumes your foes.}

You choose a point within range and cause psychic energy to explode there. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 12d4} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Psychic Shriek
entries: {@i You breathe in deeply the power of your magic before emitting a banshee howl of psychic energy that shreds the minds of your enemies.}
Choose a creature within range who can hear you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d12} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mind Howl
entries: {@i You trigger a primal fear reaction in the minds of your foes with a howl drawn from the deepest instinctual memories of their kind, leaving them panicked and confused in the face of your onslaught.}

Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. A target that fails this saving throw is {@condition frightened} of you for the duration of the spell.

Additionally whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target subtracts your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1) from the attack roll or saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shrouding
entries: {@i You use your mastery of magic to fog the minds of your enemies, clouding their sight and instincts so that you appear as nothing more than an indistinct shadow.}
Creatures have disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks made to detect you, or other creatures within the spell's radius for the duration.

Additionally you and creatures within the spell's radius are considered to be in half cover against ranged attacks even if they are in the open. If you or a creature within the spell's radius are in cover, it is considered to be one degree more protective; for example if they are in half cover, it is considered to be three-quarters cover.

spell.name: Hallucination
entries: {@i Paranoia, confusion, and panic are heightened to a debilitating degree as you alter your foe's perceptions.}

Choose a number of creatures within range equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1). Each creature must make a Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, roll a {@dice d6} and consult the table below; the creature suffers the resulting effect for the duration of the spell.

rows.name: Bugs! I hate bugs!
entries: {@i Something awful has gotten under the victim's armour, clothes, or skin and is crawling around.}

The target spends its turn {@condition incapacitated} while it flails, trying to remove whatever is crawling around, and it moves up to 15 feet in a random direction if it can move and its speed is at least 5 feet. Roll a {@dice d8} for the direction: 1, north; 2, northeast; 3, east; 4, southeast; 5, south; 6, southwest; 7, west; or 8, northwest. If the direction rolled is blocked, the target doesn't move.

rows.name: It's so beautiful!
entries: {@i All sense of urgency is lost, and the befuddled creatures stare listlessly into space.}
The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. Additionally they take their turn as if they had rolled a 0 for initiative.

If the target has already taken a turn in the round when it is affected by this spell, it does not take an additional turn at initiative 0. Should the spell end after the target's normal initiative in a round but before initiative 0, they take their turn at initiative 0.

rows.name: You! You're a traitor!
entries: {@i Paranoia sets in and the panicked creatures lash out at each other.}

For the duration of the spell, the affected creature makes an attack, casts a spell, or uses another harmful ability (creature's choice) on each of its turns against a target, chosen at random from among the creatures it can see within range of the attack, spell, or other ability it's using. If an creature would provoke an opportunity attack from the affected creature, the creature must make that attack if it is able to.
At the end of the creature's turn it can make a Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

spell.name: Hammerhand
entries: {@i Focusing the raging power of your magic, you augment your strength to the point you can crush flesh and bone with a single blow.}
For the duration of the spell you gain a +4 bonus to your Strength score. This may raise your score above 20 but not above 30.

spell.name: Purge Soul
entries: {@i You draw upon every ounce of willpower you possess to purge the evil of your foe's souls, scouring every trace of corruption even if it destroys them in the process.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. Unless the target is a celestial, it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
When an fiend or undead of CR 2 or lower fails its saving throw, the creature is instantly destroyed.

spell.name: Cleansing Flame
entries: {@i You harness the very fire in your soul, creating a wall of white-hot flame that blasts forth and purges your foes from the battlefield.}

Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures gain no benefit from cover, except full cover, against this spell. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} radiant damage and starts burning on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Dexterity saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

spell.name: Vortex of Doom

components.m: a small dagger made of knapped flint

entries: {@i You rend the material plane asunder, tearing a rift between it and the howling void of the astral plane.}

Roll a {@dice d20} when you cast this spell. On any other result than a 1, choose a point you can see within range. On a 1, the point is centered on you. A 15-foot radius sphere in the form of a swirling vortex appears in that location, a gateway to the Astral Plane.

When the vortex appears and at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute, unsecured objects within 60 feet of the sphere are pulled 20 feet toward the sphere's center, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible. Additionally the vortex moves up to 10 feet in a random direction. Roll a {@dice d6} for the direction: 1, north; 2, east; 3, south; 4, west; 5, up; 6, down. The vortex can pass through obstacles and terrain unhindered.

A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the sphere must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled 20 feet straight toward the sphere's center, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible. A creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes {@damage 8d12} force damage. If the sphere is in the air, the creature hovers inside the sphere. A creature or object that reaches the center of the vortex is sucked through it and transported to a random location on the Astral Plane.

spell.name: Dark Flame
entries: {@i You project a dark ball of magical flame that immolates your foes' souls as well as their bodies.}
Choose a point you can see within range, a 15-foot cone of dark, withering fire bursts forth in a direction of your choice.

Each creature in that cone area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage and {@damage 2d4} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

On a failed save, the target also burns. The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Dexterity saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial necrotic and fire damage both increase by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Infernal Gaze
entries: {@i Unholy power streams from your eyes, charring and melting any flesh, metal, and stone caught in its path.}

The beam forms a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose that you can see. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
You may roll the damage die for this spell twice and choose the higher result of the two. Objects and structures take double damage from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ray of Lethargy
entries: A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Dexterity and any Dexterity bonus to the target's AC is halved (rounding down) until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.
